Key Match Events: Rahmanullah Gurbaz hit 84 runs in 45 balls
Sri Lanka chased 179 runs with 4 wickets in hand and 5 balls remaining
Dasun Shanaka was dismissed by Najibullah Zadran for 27 runs
Danushka Gunathilaka scored 33 runs off 20 balls including 2 sixes and 2 fours
Bhanuka Rajapaksa scored 31 runs off 14 balls including 4 sixes and 1 four
Pre-Game Insights: Sharjah being a smaller ground than Dubai made 176 gettable
Sri Lanka held the momentum right from the first powerplay
Rashid Khan's most expensive figures ever in the UAE
Afghanistan firm favourites for the match according to Maharoof
Post-Match Reflections: Rahmanullah Gurbaz: 'Of course disappointed with the result, but that's cricket. We were short 25 runs or so, cos the wicket wasn't that difficult. I just tried to do my best, but I think the way we finished in the final overs wasn't good. Playing franchise cricket has helped a lot, because of how we train to compete in those big competitions. We hope to take the form from here to the World Cup as well.'

Dasun Shanaka: 'It's the belief of the dressing room, we believe we can chase anything in these kinds of wickets. We can always analyse the wicket better when chasing. There was a plan coming into this game, we know they have good batters, but the boys executed the plans really well. As I mentioned in the toss, partnerships was the key to winning the game. We had spoken about that, and now we now how to approach matches and win games.'

Najibullah Zadran: 'We were about 20-25 runs short, and also we didn't field well or bowl in the right areas. It's a better pitch today than the one we played on against Bangladesh, which is why I said we were a few runs short. We didn't bowl brilliantly, but we bowled really well. We dropped some catches, which if we took the game would have been different.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Four Sri Lanka batters hit quick 30s to overcome Rahmanullah Gurbaz's 45-ball 84
Najibullah Zadran got the Catch of the Match award for his incredible work on the boundary line to dismiss Dasun Shanaka
Rashid Khan conceded 1 run in his 4 overs but conceded 39 runs in total
Sri Lanka completed the highest ever chase on this ground and the highest ever chase against Afghanistan in T20s
Others: Afghanistan lost the game when they failed to review Danushka Gunathilaka's LBW the last ball of 11th over
Sri Lanka should only make 1 change to this team. Play Rajapaksha at No.3 and Aslanka at no.5
Many are talking about Afghanistan's missed chances cost them the match. Then what about that reprieve of Gurbaz at he was 5. It's SL's death bowling that won them the match. Not merely the luck.
